column4: How do I remove a program from starting when I boot my computer?

us3r_unfriendly - Well, I had apache for testing purposes and even after uninstalling it, it somehow starts on boot.  I know it has to do with /etc/default  and /etc/init but I can't really figure it out as its so different than using runlevels.

i *think* you can get to "Startup Programs" via the "system control" menu under your name on the top-right, but I'm not certain that's where Canonical moved it to when they decided we all needed "PlaySchool's My first Tablet" on our desktop PCs.
- that's more for sessions I think.
